oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Portrait of Colonel Joseph A. S. Acklen, Belmont Mansion, Nashville, Tennessee, 1979 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A portrait of Colonel Joseph Alexander Smith Acklen, photographed at Belmont Mansion circa December 1979. Acklen was a lawyer, planter, and veteran of the Texas Revolution. He was the second husband of Adelicia Hayes Franklin, later Cheatham, and the man with whom Adelicia built her summer home, Belmont, near Nashville, Tennessee. He was the son of Samuel Black Acklen and his wife, the former Elizabeth Hunt. He was born in Huntsville, Alabama in 1816. Acklen died in Louisiana, USA, on September 11th, 1863. Originally buried in Louisiana, he was later moved to the Acklen family mausoleum in Nashville. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Acklen, Adelicia, 1817-1887--Homes and haunts; Acklen, Joseph Alexander Smith, 1816-1863--Homes and haunts
